meanings.definition: The branch of technology that deals with dimensions and tolerances of less than 100 nanometers, especially the manipulation of individual atoms and molecules.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are exploring nanotech to understand how tiny particles behave.
meanings.sent2: Nanotech has revolutionized the field of medicine with its microscopic innovations.
meanings.sent3: The tiny nanotech robots in the sci-fi movie could fix anything, even broken hearts.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was like a nanotech machine, meticulously arranging every atom in its place.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of nanotech lies in its ability to manipulate the smallest building blocks of matter.

meanings.definition: The design and manufacture of extremely small electronic circuits and mechanical devices built at the molecular level.
meanings.sent1: The company specializes in nanotech, creating cutting-edge microchips for computers.
meanings.sent2: Nanotech engineers work tirelessly to improve the efficiency of electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: The nanotech factory hummed with tiny machines crafting intricate components.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a complex nanotech system, processing information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The future of technology is intertwined with the advancements in nanotech.
